intro: Lasiosiphon madagascariensis var. parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on long peduncles. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. This variant is distinguished from the typical form by its smaller, more delicate foliage.
